qas.question: What styles of cooking has Israeli cuisine adopted?
What common ingredients are in Israeli cuisine?

answers.text: falafel, hummus, shakshouka, couscous, and za'atar

qas.question: Schnitzel, pizza, hamburgers, French fries, rice and salad are also very common where?

context: Israeli cuisine has adopted, and continues to adapt, elements of various styles of Jewish cuisine, particularly the <a0_0>Mizrahi, Sephardic, and Ashkenazi<a0_0/> styles of cooking, along with Moroccan Jewish, Iraqi Jewish, Ethiopian Jewish, Indian Jewish, Iranian Jewish and Yemeni Jewish influences. It incorporates many foods traditionally eaten in the Arab, Middle Eastern and Mediterranean cuisines, such as <a1_0>falafel, hummus, shakshouka, couscous, and za'atar<a1_0/>, which have become common ingredients in Israeli cuisine. Schnitzel, pizza, hamburgers, French fries, rice and salad are also very common in <a2_0>Israel<a2_0/>.[citation needed]
